DataElement.preferredName: Iliac Crest Bone Marrow Aspirate Touch Prep Result
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text description of the result of a iliac crest biopsy and aspirate that have received touch preparation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Iliac Crest Bone Marrow Aspirate Touch Prep Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A predominate bone structure which borders the ilium wing stretching from the anterior superior iliac spine to the posterior superior iliac spine. (CDISC)_The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes._Fluid withdrawn from a lump, often a cyst, or a nipple._A glass slide with attached tissue prepared by direct touching of the tissue to the slide._The result of an action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A predominate bone structure which borders the ilium wing stretching from the anterior superior iliac spine to the posterior superior iliac spine. (CDISC):The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.:Fluid withdrawn from a lump, often a cyst, or a nipple.

Concepts.definition: The thick curved ridge in the upper area of the ilium.
The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.
Fluid withdrawn from a body cavity, organ, cyst, or tumor.

Property.preferredDefinition: A glass slide with attached tissue prepared by direct touching of the tissue to the slide.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: A glass slide with attached tissue prepared by direct touching of the tissue to the slide.
The result of an action.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Result for an antibody test, expressed as either positive (+) or negative (-).

PermissibleValues.value: No morphologic or immunophenotypic evidence of lymphoma
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Negative Morphology Immunophenotype Lymphoma Bone Marrow

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Negative Morphology Immunophenotype Lymphoma Bone Marrow
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Involving disadvantage or harm.: The science of the form and structure of organisms (plants, animals, and other forms of life), or of their parts, and the study or science of the same.  In pathology, the specific appearance of cells and tissues (normal and abnormal) under the light or electron microscope.: The characterization of a set of cells according to the antigens expressed.: A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites. This category includes Non-Hodgkin lymphomas and Hodgkin lymphomas.: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.

Concepts.definition: Involving disadvantage or harm.

The science of the form and structure of organisms (plants, animals, and other forms of life), or of their parts, and the study or science of the same.  In pathology, the specific appearance of cells and tissues (normal and abnormal) under the light or electron microscope.
The characterization of a set of cells according to the antigens expressed.

A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites. This category includes Non-Hodgkin lymphomas and Hodgkin lymphomas.
The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Increase Phagocytic Cell Histiocyte Bone Marrow

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Increase Phagocytic Cell Histiocyte Bone Marrow
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A process of becoming larger, more numerous, more important, or more likely.: A type of immune cell that can surround and kill microorganisms, ingest foreign material, and remove dead cells. It can also boost immune responses. Monocytes, macrophages, and neutrophils are phagocytes. A phagocyte is a type of white blood cell.: A macrophage present in connective tissue.: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.

Concepts.definition: A process of becoming larger, more numerous, more important, or more likely.

A type of immune cell that can surround and kill microorganisms, ingest foreign material, and remove dead cells. It can also boost immune responses. Monocytes, macrophages, and neutrophils are phagocytes. A phagocyte is a type of white blood cell.
A macrophage present in connective tissue.
The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.

PermissibleValues.value: Normocellular bone marrow with erythroid predominance and decreased megakaryocytes
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Erythroid Main Reduced Megakaryocyte Bone Marrow

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Erythroid Main Reduced Megakaryocyte Bone Marrow
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: 1) Reddish in color. 2) relating to erythrocytes or their precursors.: Most important; principal.: Made less in size or amount or degree.: Very large bone marrow cells which release mature blood platelets.: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.

Concepts.definition: 1) Reddish in color. 2) relating to erythrocytes or their precursors.
Most important; principal.
Made less in size or amount or degree.
Very large bone marrow cells which release mature blood platelets.
The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: The result of an action.
